00070 //
00071 // Definition of the in-memory high-level intermediate representation
00072 // of shaders.  This is a tree that parser creates.
00073 //
00074 // Nodes in the tree are defined as a hierarchy of classes derived from 
00075 // TIntermNode. Each is a node in a tree.  There is no preset branching factor;
00076 // each node can have it's own type of list of children.
00077 //
00078 
00079 #ifndef __INTERMEDIATE_H
00080 #define __INTERMEDIATE_H
00081 
00082 #include "../Include/Common.h"
00083 #include "../Include/Types.h"
00084 #include "../Include/ConstantUnion.h"
00085 
00086 //
00087 // Operators used by the high-level (parse tree) representation.
00088 //
00089 enum TOperator
00090 {
00091    EOpNull,            // if in a node, should only mean a node is still being built
00092    EOpSequence,        // denotes a list of statements, or parameters, etc.
00093    EOpFunctionCall,    
00094    EOpFunction,        // For function definition
00095    EOpParameters,      // an aggregate listing the parameters to a function
00096 
00097    //
00098    // Unary operators
00099    //
00100 
00101    EOpNegative,
00102    EOpLogicalNot,
00103    EOpVectorLogicalNot,
00104    EOpBitwiseNot,
00105 
00106    EOpPostIncrement,
00107    EOpPostDecrement,
00108    EOpPreIncrement,
00109    EOpPreDecrement,
00110 
00111    EOpConvIntToBool,
00112    EOpConvFloatToBool,
00113    EOpConvBoolToFloat,
00114    EOpConvIntToFloat,
00115    EOpConvFloatToInt,
00116    EOpConvBoolToInt,
00117 
00118    //
00119    // binary operations
00120    //
00121 
00122    EOpAdd,
00123    EOpSub,
00124    EOpMul,
00125    EOpDiv,
00126    EOpMod,
00127    EOpRightShift,
00128    EOpLeftShift,
00129    EOpAnd,
00130    EOpInclusiveOr,
00131    EOpExclusiveOr,
00132    EOpEqual,
00133    EOpNotEqual,
00134    EOpVectorEqual,
00135    EOpVectorNotEqual,
00136    EOpLessThan,
00137    EOpGreaterThan,
00138    EOpLessThanEqual,
00139    EOpGreaterThanEqual,
00140    EOpComma,
00141 
00142    EOpVectorTimesScalar,
00143    EOpVectorTimesMatrix,
00144    EOpMatrixTimesVector,
00145    EOpMatrixTimesScalar,
00146 
00147    EOpLogicalOr,
00148    EOpLogicalXor,
00149    EOpLogicalAnd,
00150 
00151    EOpIndexDirect,
00152    EOpIndexIndirect,
00153    EOpIndexDirectStruct,
00154 
00155    EOpVectorSwizzle,
00156    EOpMatrixSwizzle,
00157 
00158    //
00159    // Built-in functions potentially mapped to operators
00160    //
00161 
00162    EOpRadians,
00163    EOpDegrees,
00164    EOpSin,
00165    EOpCos,
00166    EOpTan,
00167    EOpAsin,
00168    EOpAcos,
00169    EOpAtan,
00170    EOpAtan2,
00171    EOpSinCos,
00172 
00173    EOpPow,
00174    EOpExp,
00175    EOpLog,
00176    EOpExp2,
00177    EOpLog2,
00178    EOpLog10,
00179    EOpSqrt,
00180    EOpInverseSqrt,
00181 
00182    EOpAbs,
00183    EOpSign,
00184    EOpFloor,
00185    EOpCeil,
00186    EOpFract,
00187    EOpMin,
00188    EOpMax,
00189    EOpClamp,
00190    EOpMix,
00191    EOpStep,
00192    EOpSmoothStep,
00193 
00194    EOpLength,
00195    EOpDistance,
00196    EOpDot,
00197    EOpCross,
00198    EOpNormalize,
00199    EOpFaceForward,
00200    EOpReflect,
00201    EOpRefract,
00202 
00203    EOpDPdx,            // Fragment only
00204    EOpDPdy,            // Fragment only
00205    EOpFwidth,          // Fragment only
00206 
00207    //Added for HLSL support
00208    EOpTex1D,
00209    EOpTex1DProj,
00210    EOpTex1DLod,
00211    EOpTex1DBias,
00212    EOpTex1DGrad,
00213    EOpTex2D,
00214    EOpTex2DProj,
00215    EOpTex2DLod,
00216    EOpTex2DBias,
00217    EOpTex2DGrad,
00218    EOpTex3D,
00219    EOpTex3DProj,
00220    EOpTex3DLod,
00221    EOpTex3DBias,
00222    EOpTex3DGrad,
00223    EOpTexCube,
00224    EOpTexCubeProj,
00225    EOpTexCubeLod,
00226    EOpTexCubeBias,
00227    EOpTexCubeGrad,
00228 
00229    EOpTranspose,
00230    EOpDeterminant,
00231    EOpSaturate,
00232    EOpModf,
00233    EOpLdexp,
00234 
00235    EOpMatrixTimesMatrix,
00236 
00237    EOpAny,
00238    EOpAll,
00239 
00240    EOpItof,         // pack/unpack only
00241    EOpFtoi,         // pack/unpack only    
00242    EOpSkipPixels,   // pack/unpack only
00243    EOpReadInput,    // unpack only
00244    EOpWritePixel,   // unpack only
00245    EOpBitmapLsb,    // unpack only
00246    EOpBitmapMsb,    // unpack only
00247    EOpWriteOutput,  // pack only
00248    EOpReadPixel,    // pack only
00249 
00250    //
00251    // Branch
00252    //
00253 
00254    EOpKill,            // Fragment only
00255    EOpReturn,
00256    EOpBreak,
00257    EOpContinue,
00258 
00259    //
00260    // Constructors
00261    //
00262 
00263    EOpConstructInt,
00264    EOpConstructBool,
00265    EOpConstructFloat,
00266    EOpConstructVec2,
00267    EOpConstructVec3,
00268    EOpConstructVec4,
00269    EOpConstructBVec2,
00270    EOpConstructBVec3,
00271    EOpConstructBVec4,
00272    EOpConstructIVec2,
00273    EOpConstructIVec3,
00274    EOpConstructIVec4,
00275    EOpConstructMat2,
00276    EOpConstructMat3,
00277    EOpConstructMat4,
00278    EOpConstructStruct,
00279 
00280    //HLSL matrix/matrix constructors
00281    EOpConstructMat2FromMat,
00282    EOpConstructMat3FromMat,
00283 
00284    //
00285    // moves
00286    //
00287 
00288    EOpAssign,
00289    EOpInitialize,  //Special Assign only happening at declaration
00290    EOpAddAssign,
00291    EOpSubAssign,
00292    EOpMulAssign,
00293    EOpVectorTimesMatrixAssign,
00294    EOpVectorTimesScalarAssign,
00295    EOpMatrixTimesScalarAssign,
00296    EOpMatrixTimesMatrixAssign,
00297    EOpDivAssign,
00298    EOpModAssign,
00299    EOpAndAssign,
00300    EOpInclusiveOrAssign,
00301    EOpExclusiveOrAssign,
00302    EOpLeftShiftAssign,
00303    EOpRightShiftAssign,
00304 
00305    //
00306    // Array operators
00307    //
00308 
00309    EOpArrayLength,
00310 
00311    //
00312    // Special HLSL functions
00313    //
00314    EOpD3DCOLORtoUBYTE4,
00315 };

00317 class TIntermTraverser;
00318 class TIntermAggregate;
00319 class TIntermBinary;
00320 class TIntermConstantUnion;
00321 class TIntermSelection;
00322 class TIntermTyped;
00323 class TIntermSymbol;
00324 class TInfoSink;
00325 
00326 //
00327 // Base class for the tree nodes
00328 //
00329 class TIntermNode
00330 {
00331 public:
00332    POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE(GlobalPoolAllocator)
00333 
00334    TIntermNode() : line(0)
00335    {
00336    }
00337    virtual TSourceLoc getLine() const
00338    {
00339       return line;
00340    }
00341    virtual void setLine(TSourceLoc l)
00342    {
00343       line = l;
00344    }
00345    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*) = 0;
00346    virtual TIntermTyped*     getAsTyped()
00347    {
00348       return 0;
00349    }
00350    virtual TIntermConstantUnion*     getAsConstantUnion()
00351    {
00352       return 0;
00353    }
00354    virtual TIntermAggregate* getAsAggregate()
00355    {
00356       return 0;
00357    }
00358    virtual TIntermBinary*    getAsBinaryNode()
00359    {
00360       return 0;
00361    }
00362    virtual TIntermSelection* getAsSelectionNode()
00363    {
00364       return 0;
00365    }
00366    virtual TIntermSymbol*    getAsSymbolNode()
00367    {
00368       return 0;
00369    }
00370    virtual ~TIntermNode()
00371    {
00372    }
00373 protected:
00374    TSourceLoc line;
00375 };
00376 
00377 //
00378 // This is just to help yacc.
00379 //
00380 struct TIntermNodePair
00381 {
00382    TIntermNode* node1;
00383    TIntermNode* node2;
00384 };
00385 
00386 class TIntermSymbol;
00387 class TIntermBinary;
00388 
00389 //
00390 // Intermediate class for nodes that have a type.
00391 //
00392 class TIntermTyped : public TIntermNode
00393 {
00394 public:
00395    TIntermTyped(const TType& t) : type(t)
00396    {
00397    }
00398    virtual TIntermTyped* getAsTyped()
00399    {
00400       return this;
00401    }
00402    virtual void setType(const TType& t)
00403    {
00404       type = t;
00405    }
00406    virtual TType getType() const
00407    {
00408       return type;
00409    }
00410    virtual TType* getTypePointer()
00411    {
00412       return &type;
00413    }
00414 
00415    virtual TBasicType getBasicType() const
00416    {
00417       return type.getBasicType();
00418    }
00419    virtual TQualifier getQualifier() const
00420    {
00421       return type.getQualifier();
00422    }
00423    virtual int getNominalSize() const
00424    {
00425       return type.getNominalSize();
00426    }
00427    virtual int getSize() const
00428    {
00429       return type.getInstanceSize();
00430    }
00431    virtual bool isMatrix() const
00432    {
00433       return type.isMatrix();
00434    }
00435    virtual bool isArray()  const
00436    {
00437       return type.isArray();
00438    }
00439    virtual bool isVector() const
00440    {
00441       return type.isVector();
00442    }
00443    const char* getBasicString()      const
00444    {
00445       return type.getBasicString();
00446    }
00447    const char* getQualifierString()  const
00448    {
00449       return type.getQualifierString();
00450    }
00451    TString getCompleteString() const
00452    {
00453       return type.getCompleteString();
00454    }
00455 
00456 protected:
00457    TType type;
00458 };
00459 
00460 //
00461 // Handle for, do-while, and while loops.
00462 //
00463 class TIntermLoop : public TIntermNode
00464 {
00465 public:
00466    TIntermLoop(TIntermNode* aBody, TIntermTyped* aTest, TIntermTyped* aTerminal, bool testFirst) : 
00467    body(aBody),
00468    test(aTest),
00469    terminal(aTerminal),
00470    first(testFirst)
00471    {
00472    }
00473    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00474    TIntermNode*  getBody()
00475    {
00476       return body;
00477    }
00478    TIntermTyped* getTest()
00479    {
00480       return test;
00481    }
00482    TIntermTyped* getTerminal()
00483    {
00484       return terminal;
00485    }
00486    bool testFirst()
00487    {
00488       return first;
00489    }
00490 protected:
00491    TIntermNode* body;       // code to loop over
00492    TIntermTyped* test;      // exit condition associated with loop, could be 0 for 'for' loops
00493    TIntermTyped* terminal;  // exists for for-loops
00494    bool first;              // true for while and for, not for do-while
00495 };
00496 
00497 //
00498 // Handle break, continue, return, and kill.
00499 //
00500 class TIntermBranch : public TIntermNode
00501 {
00502 public:
00503    TIntermBranch(TOperator op, TIntermTyped* e) :
00504    flowOp(op),
00505    expression(e)
00506    {
00507    }
00508    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00509    TOperator getFlowOp()
00510    {
00511       return flowOp;
00512    }
00513    TIntermTyped* getExpression()
00514    {
00515       return expression;
00516    }
00517 protected:
00518    TOperator flowOp;
00519    TIntermTyped* expression;  // non-zero except for "return exp;" statements
00520 };
00521 
00522 //
00523 // Nodes that correspond to symbols or constants in the source code.
00524 //
00525 class TIntermSymbol : public TIntermTyped
00526 {
00527 public:
00528    // if symbol is initialized as symbol(sym), the memory comes from the poolallocator of sym. If sym comes from
00529    // per process globalpoolallocator, then it causes increased memory usage per compile
00530    // it is essential to use "symbol = sym" to assign to symbol
00531    TIntermSymbol(int i, const TString& sym, const TType& t) : 
00532    TIntermTyped(t), id(i), info(0)
00533    {
00534       symbol = sym;
00535    } 
00536    TIntermSymbol(int i, const TString& sym, const TTypeInfo *inf, const TType& t) : 
00537    TIntermTyped(t), id(i), info(inf)
00538    {
00539       symbol = sym;
00540    } 
00541    virtual int getId() const
00542    {
00543       return id;
00544    }
00545    virtual const TString& getSymbol() const
00546    {
00547       return symbol;
00548    }
00549    virtual const TTypeInfo* getInfo() const
00550    {
00551       return info;
00552    }
00553    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00554    virtual TIntermSymbol* getAsSymbolNode()
00555    {
00556       return this;
00557    }
00558 protected:
00559    int id;
00560    TString symbol;
00561    const TTypeInfo *info;
00562 };
00563 
00564 class TIntermConstantUnion : public TIntermTyped
00565 {
00566 public:
00567    TIntermConstantUnion(constUnion *unionPointer, const TType& t) : TIntermTyped(t), unionArrayPointer(unionPointer)
00568    {
00569    }
00570    constUnion* getUnionArrayPointer() const
00571    {
00572       return unionArrayPointer;
00573    }
00574    void setUnionArrayPointer(constUnion *c)
00575    {
00576       unionArrayPointer = c;
00577    }
00578    virtual TIntermConstantUnion* getAsConstantUnion()
00579    {
00580       return this;
00581    }
00582    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser* );
00583    virtual TIntermTyped* fold(TOperator, TIntermTyped*, TInfoSink&);
00584 protected:
00585    constUnion *unionArrayPointer;
00586 };
00587 
00588 //
00589 // Intermediate class for node types that hold operators.
00590 //
00591 class TIntermOperator : public TIntermTyped
00592 {
00593 public:
00594    TOperator getOp()
00595    {
00596       return op;
00597    }
00598    bool modifiesState() const;
00599    bool isConstructor() const;
00600    virtual bool promote(TInfoSink&)
00601    {
00602       return true;
00603    }
00604 protected:
00605    TIntermOperator(TOperator o) : TIntermTyped(TType(EbtFloat)), op(o)
00606    {
00607    }
00608    TIntermOperator(TOperator o, TType& t) : TIntermTyped(t), op(o)
00609    {
00610    }   
00611    TOperator op;
00612 };
00613 
00614 //
00615 // Nodes for all the basic binary math operators.
00616 //
00617 class TIntermBinary : public TIntermOperator
00618 {
00619 public:
00620    TIntermBinary(TOperator o) : TIntermOperator(o)
00621    {
00622    }
00623    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00624    virtual void setLeft(TIntermTyped* n)
00625    {
00626       left = n;
00627    }
00628    virtual void setRight(TIntermTyped* n)
00629    {
00630       right = n;
00631    }
00632    virtual TIntermTyped* getLeft() const
00633    {
00634       return left;
00635    }
00636    virtual TIntermTyped* getRight() const
00637    {
00638       return right;
00639    }
00640    virtual TIntermBinary* getAsBinaryNode()
00641    {
00642       return this;
00643    }
00644    virtual bool promote(TInfoSink&);
00645 protected:
00646    TIntermTyped* left;
00647    TIntermTyped* right;
00648 };
00649 
00650 //
00651 // Nodes for unary math operators.
00652 //
00653 class TIntermUnary : public TIntermOperator
00654 {
00655 public:
00656    TIntermUnary(TOperator o, TType& t) : TIntermOperator(o, t), operand(0)
00657    {
00658    }
00659    TIntermUnary(TOperator o) : TIntermOperator(o), operand(0)
00660    {
00661    }
00662    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00663    virtual void setOperand(TIntermTyped* o)
00664    {
00665       operand = o;
00666    }
00667    virtual TIntermTyped* getOperand()
00668    {
00669       return operand;
00670    }
00671    virtual bool promote(TInfoSink&);
00672 protected:
00673    TIntermTyped* operand;
00674 };
00675 
00676 typedef TVector<TIntermNode*> TIntermSequence;
00677 typedef TVector<int> TQualifierList;
00678 //
00679 // Nodes that operate on an arbitrary sized set of children.
00680 //
00681 class TIntermAggregate : public TIntermOperator
00682 {
00683 public:
00684    TIntermAggregate() : TIntermOperator(EOpNull), userDefined(false), pragmaTable(0)
00685    {
00686    }
00687    TIntermAggregate(TOperator o) : TIntermOperator(o), pragmaTable(0)
00688    {
00689    }
00690    ~TIntermAggregate()
00691    {
00692       delete pragmaTable;
00693    }
00694    virtual TIntermAggregate* getAsAggregate()
00695    {
00696       return this;
00697    }
00698    virtual void setOperator(TOperator o)
00699    {
00700       op = o;
00701    }
00702    virtual TIntermSequence& getSequence()
00703    {
00704       return sequence;
00705    }
00706    virtual void setName(const TString& n)
00707    {
00708       name = n;
00709    }
00710    virtual void setPlainName(const TString& n)
00711    {
00712       plainName = n;
00713    }
00714    virtual void setSemantic(const TString& s)
00715    {
00716       semantic = s;
00717    }
00718    virtual const TString& getName() const
00719    {
00720       return name;
00721    }
00722    virtual const TString& getPlainName() const
00723    {
00724       return plainName;
00725    }
00726    virtual const TString& getSemantic() const
00727    {
00728       return semantic;
00729    }
00730    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00731    virtual void setUserDefined()
00732    {
00733       userDefined = true;
00734    }
00735    virtual bool isUserDefined()
00736    {
00737       return userDefined;
00738    }
00739    virtual TQualifierList& getQualifier()
00740    {
00741       return qualifier;
00742    }
00743    void setOptimize(bool o)
00744    {
00745       optimize = o;
00746    }
00747    void setDebug(bool d)
00748    {
00749       debug = d;
00750    }
00751    bool getOptimize()
00752    {
00753       return optimize;
00754    }
00755    bool getDebug()
00756    {
00757       return debug;
00758    }
00759    void addToPragmaTable(const TPragmaTable& pTable);
00760    const TPragmaTable& getPragmaTable() const
00761    {
00762       return *pragmaTable;
00763    }
00764 protected:
00765    TIntermAggregate(const TIntermAggregate&); // disallow copy constructor
00766    TIntermAggregate& operator=(const TIntermAggregate&); // disallow assignment operator
00767    TIntermSequence sequence;
00768    TQualifierList qualifier;
00769    TString name;
00770    TString plainName;
00771    TString semantic;
00772    bool userDefined; // used for user defined function names
00773    bool optimize;
00774    bool debug;
00775    TPragmaTable *pragmaTable;
00776 };
00777 
00778 //
00779 // For if tests.  Simplified since there is no switch statement.
00780 //
00781 class TIntermSelection : public TIntermTyped
00782 {
00783 public:
00784    TIntermSelection(TIntermTyped* cond, TIntermNode* trueB, TIntermNode* falseB) :
00785    TIntermTyped(TType(EbtVoid)), condition(cond), trueBlock(trueB), falseBlock(falseB)
00786    {
00787    }
00788    TIntermSelection(TIntermTyped* cond, TIntermNode* trueB, TIntermNode* falseB, const TType& type) :
00789    TIntermTyped(type), condition(cond), trueBlock(trueB), falseBlock(falseB)
00790    {
00791    }
00792    virtual void traverse(TIntermTraverser*);
00793    virtual TIntermNode* getCondition() const
00794    {
00795       return condition;
00796    }
00797    virtual TIntermNode* getTrueBlock() const
00798    {
00799       return trueBlock;
00800    }
00801    virtual TIntermNode* getFalseBlock() const
00802    {
00803       return falseBlock;
00804    }
00805    virtual TIntermSelection* getAsSelectionNode()
00806    {
00807       return this;
00808    }
00809 protected:
00810    TIntermTyped* condition;
00811    TIntermNode* trueBlock;
00812    TIntermNode* falseBlock;
00813 };
00814 
00815 //
00816 // For traversing the tree.  User should derive from this, 
00817 // put their traversal specific data in it, and then pass
00818 // it to a Traverse method.
00819 //
00820 // When using this, just fill in the methods for nodes you want visited.
00821 // Return false from a pre-visit to skip visiting that node's subtree.
00822 //
00823 class TIntermTraverser
00824 {
00825 public:
00826    POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE(GlobalPoolAllocator)
00827 
00828    TIntermTraverser() : 
00829       visitSymbol(0), 
00830       visitConstantUnion(0),
00831       visitBinary(0),
00832       visitUnary(0),
00833       visitSelection(0),
00834       visitAggregate(0),
00835       visitLoop(0),
00836       visitBranch(0),
00837       depth(0),
00838       preVisit(true),
00839       postVisit(false),
00840       rightToLeft(false)
00841    {
00842    }
00843 
00844    void (*visitSymbol)(TIntermSymbol*, TIntermTraverser*);
00845    void (*visitConstantUnion)(TIntermConstantUnion*, TIntermTraverser*);
00846    bool (*visitBinary)(bool preVisit, TIntermBinary*, TIntermTraverser*);
00847    bool (*visitUnary)(bool preVisit, TIntermUnary*, TIntermTraverser*);
00848    bool (*visitSelection)(bool preVisit, TIntermSelection*, TIntermTraverser*);
00849    bool (*visitAggregate)(bool preVisit, TIntermAggregate*, TIntermTraverser*);
00850    bool (*visitLoop)(bool preVisit, TIntermLoop*, TIntermTraverser*);
00851    bool (*visitBranch)(bool preVisit, TIntermBranch*,  TIntermTraverser*);
00852 
00853    int  depth;
00854    bool preVisit;
00855    bool postVisit;
00856    bool rightToLeft;
00857 };
